summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Board of Adjustment (Panel A) will convene on March 19, 2024, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall, Room 6ES, and will also be accessible via videoconference. The purpose of the meeting is to address various zoning and adjustment requests from residents and to ensure equitable access to the meeting for all participants.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public hearing, and public testimony. Key items for discussion involve several uncontested cases and holdover items related to variances and special exceptions concerning zoning regulations, particularly regarding front-yard setbacks and fence height.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include requests for variances from front-yard setback regulations at multiple locations, as well as special exceptions for fence height and visibility obstruction regulations. Notable cases include applications from Rick Smith, Joel Perales, Rob Baldwin, Jordan Heetland, and Dejuan Session, among others.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is expected to approve minutes from the previous meeting and make decisions on the listed cases, including variances and special exceptions. Individuals wishing to speak must register by March 18, 2024, to participate in the public hearing. The meeting also includes provisions for a closed executive session if necessary, to discuss legal or personnel matters.
